qas.question: How long ago were rock paintings found in Somalia created?
Where are the most notable rock paintings located?
Along with animals, what is depicted on the rock paintings of Laas Geel?
Where does a notable rock painting of a man on horseback exist?
In what geographic part of Somalia are these rock paintings commonly found?

context: Ancient rock paintings in Somalia which date back to <a0_0>5000 years<a0_0/> have been found in the <a4_0>northern<a4_0/> part of the country, depicting early life in the territory. The most famous of these is <a1_0>the Laas Geel complex<a1_0/>, which contains some of the earliest known rock art on the African continent and features many elaborate pastoralist sketches of animal and <a2_0>human figures<a2_0/>. In other places, such as <a3_0>the northern Dhambalin region<a3_0/>, a depiction of a man on a horse is postulated as being one of the earliest known examples of a mounted huntsman.
